intro: Baeothryon pusillum, commonly known as the small baeothryon, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny habitats. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Baeothryon pusillum is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
